text.div:
BCI ExceptionValueVS ValueSet

Reasons that a value associated with a test or other finding is missing.

name: BCI ExceptionValueVS ValueSet
title: BCI ExceptionValueVS ValueSet
publisher: The MITRE Corporation: Standard Health Record Collaborative
description: Reasons that a value associated with a test or other finding is missing.

concept.display: The source human does not know the value.
There is reason to expect (from the workflow) that the value may become known.
The workflow didn't lead to this value being known.
The information is not available due to security, privacy or related reasons.
The source system wasn't capable of supporting this element.
The content of the data is represented in the resource narrative.
Some system or workflow process error means that the information is not available.
NaN, standing for not a number, is a numeric data type value representing an undefined or unrepresentable value.
The value is not available because the observation procedure  (test, etc.) was not performed.
Human source was asked but declined to respond to the question, or an applicable question was left unanswered.
The reason the information is not present is not known.
The answer is missing because nothing of a type of thing is known to exists, e.g., the siblings of an only child. Also use this code to represent a 'none of the above' answer
Missing due to a problem collecting, identifying, or locating the specimen, including patient refusal or unable to provide specimen
Missing due to a problem with the specimen, e.g. inadequate specimen, contamination, clotting, improper tube type, improper storage, too small, etc.
